page.title: 16INDUSTRY AROUND STAINLAND
page.content: The raw wool is cleaned and spun before it is made into cloth.It is sent to{Sowerby Bridge}to be dyed and is returned the same day to be finished.The cloth is of a high quality because the water used to wash it comes from Black Brook and is very soft. Nearly all college and university scarves are made from the material made at Bury Mill. {Norcliffes Mill} Norcliffes Mill is in the same valley as Bury Mill and uses the same water supply.They make material for car seats and caravan seats. They use an assortment of yarns.Some comes from Italy but the rest is local yarn.The wool is cleaned and dyed before it is spun.It is then woven with the imported yarns into a stripey upholstery fabric.
